- One area that Biden’s message doesn’t address: The recent manufacturing job gains leave employment well below historical highs. correction_response:
This tweet is partially misinformed. While it's true that the fact-check may seem negative towards Biden, it's important to note that it's providing context to his claim about job creation. Biden's statement about creating 700,000 manufacturing jobs is numerically correct, but it doesn't account for other factors like the pandemic relief bills that began under Trump and contributed to the rise in manufacturing jobs. Also, the recent job gains still leave manufacturing employment well below historical highs. Therefore, the fact-check isn't necessarily smearing negativity, but rather providing a more nuanced view of the situation. 
References: 
https://www.politifact.com/article/2022/nov/01/joe-biden-and-manufacturing-jobs-closer-look/
https://www.politico.com/news/2020/09/16/trump-manufacturing-jobs-record-415588
